review_text:
Bought this laptop for a student, the battery life is great, I was pretty much impress bu this laptop.
not so much for the Windows 10 in S mode, which mean you are not able to download anything that is not on the windows store, forget Chrome and Firefox browser, unless you visit Microsoft store and download the app and disable the S mode, great to have 12 months of Office 365 free. would I recommend this laptop top? to a student and light usage like movies and browsing, text editing yes, definitely fits the student budget.
author: TechnoMan
product_name: Acer Aspire One, 15.6" Full HD, Celeron ICD N4020, 4Gb RAM, 64GB eMMC, Windows 10S, Black, A115-31-C2Y3

review_text: You're basically buying a Windows 10 alternative to a Chromebook, and on that scale it more than satisfies. Large screen, high res, respectable number of ports, lightweight, doesn't need a fan to cool. But this is just for the basics - streaming, browsing, office stuff. It's not made for heavy lifting, so know what you're getting before you buy it.
author: Noah
product_name: Acer Aspire One, 15.6" Full HD, Celeron ICD N4020, 4Gb RAM, 64GB eMMC, Windows 10S, Black, A115-31-C2Y3

review_text:
I bought this for my mom to replace her old desktop, and it works great for her general browsing, email access, etc.
Acer is always reliable.
The small flash drive storage is fine for her needs, and makes it a cheaper option, she doesn't need a huge HDD for storage.

review_text: Le touchpad est defectueux. Alors le curseur a l'ecran dance partout a une vitesse folle. Souvent impossible de rentrer mon mot de passe a l'ouverture. Ou je click sur ma corbeille et c'est youtube qui ouvre.Dommage car pour le reste ca semblais un bon laptop. J'ai tenter meme d'aller regler le probleme dans le BIOS. Rien a faire.Le probleme semble mecanique.Je vais mettre un peu plus d'argent pour plus de qualiter.Je le retourne aujourd'hui ;/
